availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of M. and M. B. Marshall. Married to Susan Myers on October 7, 1934. Father of Elizabeth Marshall, Thomas Marshall, Martin Marshall, William Marshall, George Marshall, Matilda Marshall, Robert Marshall, Margaret Marshall, Charles Marshall. Member of the Convention to for the Revision of the Constitution of the State of Kentucky in 1849. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1834 to 1835, 1840 to 1843, 1844 to 1845, and 1850 to 1851. Attorney in Bracken County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
